briefdescription.para: Compute MFE and according consensus structure of an alignment of sequences.

detaileddescription.para: This function predicts the consensus structure for the aligned 'sequences' and returns the minimum free energy; the mfe structure in bracket notation is returned in 'structure'.
Sufficient space must be allocated for 'structure' before calling alifold().

xrefdescription.para: Usage of this function is discouraged! Use vrna_alifold(), or vrna_mfe() instead!

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a NULL terminated array of character arrays
A pointer to a character array that may contain a constraining consensus structure (will be overwritten by a consensus structure that exhibits the MFE)

simplesect.para: The free energy score in kcal/mol

briefdescription.para: Compute MFE and according structure of an alignment of sequences assuming the sequences are circular instead of linear.

xrefdescription.para: Usage of this function is discouraged! Use vrna_alicircfold(), and vrna_mfe() instead!

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a NULL terminated array of character arrays
A pointer to a character array that may contain a constraining consensus structure (will be overwritten by a consensus structure that exhibits the MFE)

simplesect.para: The free energy score in kcal/mol

briefdescription.para: Free the memory occupied by MFE alifold functions.

xrefdescription.para: Usage of this function is discouraged! It only affects memory being free'd that was allocated by an old API function before. Release of memory occupied by the newly introduced vrna_fold_compound_t is handled by vrna_fold_compound_free()

memberdef.argsstring: (const char **sequences, char *structure, vrna_ep_t **pl, vrna_exp_param_t *parameters, int calculate_bppm, int is_constrained, int is_circular)
memberdef.name: alipf_fold_par

briefdescription.para: The partition function version of alifold() works in analogy to pf_fold(). Pair probabilities and information about sequence covariations are returned via the 'pi' variable as a list of vrna_pinfo_t structs. The list is terminated by the first entry with pi.i = 0.
Get a pointer to the base pair probability array.

detaileddescription.para: Accessing the base pair probabilities for a pair (i,j) is achieved by FLT_OR_DBL *pr = export_bppm(); pr_ij = pr[iindx[i]-j];

xrefdescription.para: Usage of this function is discouraged! The new vrna_fold_compound_t allows direct access to the folding matrices, including the pair probabilities! The pair probability array returned here reflects the one of the latest call to vrna_pf(), or any of the old API calls for consensus structure partition function folding.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the base pair probability array

briefdescription.para: Free the memory occupied by folding matrices allocated by alipf_fold, alipf_circ_fold, etc.

xrefdescription.para: Usage of this function is discouraged! This function only free's memory allocated by old API function calls. Memory allocated by any of the new API calls (starting with vrna_) will be not affected!

briefdescription.para: Sample a consensus secondary structure from the Boltzmann ensemble according its probability.

simplesect.para: A sampled consensus secondary structure in dot-bracket notation

memberdef.argsstring: (short ***S_p, short ***S5_p, short ***S3_p, unsigned short ***a2s_p, char ***Ss_p, FLT_OR_DBL **qb_p, FLT_OR_DBL **qm_p, FLT_OR_DBL **q1k_p, FLT_OR_DBL **qln_p, short **pscore)
memberdef.name: get_alipf_arrays

briefdescription.para: Get pointers to (almost) all relavant arrays used in alifold's partition function computation.

simplesect.para: To obtain meaningful pointers, call alipf_fold first!

xrefdescription.para: It is discouraged to use this function! The new vrna_fold_compound_t allows direct access to all necessary consensus structure prediction related variables!

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the 'S' array (integer representation of nucleotides)
A pointer to the alignment-column to sequence position mapping array
A pointer to the QB matrix
A pointer to the QM matrix
A pointer to the 5' slice of the Q matrix ( $q1k(k) = Q(1, k)$)
A pointer to the 3' slice of the Q matrix ( $qln(l) = Q(l, n)$)
A pointer to the start of a pscore list

simplesect.para: Non Zero if everything went fine, 0 otherwise

briefdescription.para: This variable controls the weight of the covariance term in the energy function of alignment folding algorithms.

xrefdescription.para: See vrna_md_t.cv_fact, and vrna_mfe() to avoid using global variables

briefdescription.para: This variable controls the magnitude of the penalty for non-compatible sequences in the covariance term of alignment folding algorithms.

xrefdescription.para: See vrna_md_t.nc_fact, and vrna_mfe() to avoid using global variables

memberdef.argsstring: (const char **sequences, const char *structure, int n_seq, float *energy)
memberdef.name: energy_of_alistruct

briefdescription.para: Calculate the free energy of a consensus structure given a set of aligned sequences.

xrefdescription.para: Usage of this function is discouraged! Use vrna_eval_structure(), and vrna_eval_covar_structure() instead!

parameterdescription.para: The NULL terminated array of sequences
The number of sequences in the alignment
A pointer to an array of at least two floats that will hold the free energies (energy[0] will contain the free energy, energy[1] will be filled with the covariance energy term)

memberdef.argsstring: (const char **sequences, const char *structure, int n_seq, float *energy)
memberdef.name: energy_of_ali_gquad_structure

briefdescription.para: Update the energy parameters for alifold function.

detaileddescription.para: Call this to recalculate the pair matrix and energy parameters after a change in folding parameters like temperature

xrefdescription.para: Usage of this function is discouraged! The new API uses vrna_fold_compound_t to lump all folding related necessities together, including the energy parameters. Use vrna_update_fold_params() to update the energy parameters within a vrna_fold_compound_t.

briefdescription.para: Functions for comparative structure prediction using RNA sequence alignments.
